turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If you're having some.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I am. Have a seat.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You get a chance to use it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I felt a lot safer having it. My milk went bad when I was in jail.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Black's fine.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Thanks, but I have my own now.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You went out this morning and bought a gun?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What, I couldn't hear you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You went out this morning and bought a gun.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Somebody loan it to you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Want to hear some music?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I couldn't wait till I got home last night and wash my hair.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It looks nice.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You never got into the whole CD revolution?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I got a few. But I can't afford to start all over again. I got too much time and money invested in my records.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This is pretty.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The Delfonics.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: '74, I think.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's nice.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I called in sick this morning. As far as the airline knows, I'm still available.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know yet. I'm going to talk with Dargus and Nicolet today. Do what you suggested. Offer to help and see what happens.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What I meant was have a lawyer do the negotiating for you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I want to talk to them first. I know more now about Ordell's money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well, if the A.T.F. guy is the one who wants you, that'll only interest him up to a point.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's a lot of money. About a half-a- million dollars. All of it in Cabo in safe deposit boxes and more comin' in.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How'd you find that out?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He told me last night.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He called you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He came by.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What?... What'd you do?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We talked.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He had his doubts at first. But he's always trusted me an wants more than anything to believe he still can.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He needs me. Without me all that money is just gonna sit over there in Cabo. Sugar?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No thanks. There's gotta be other ways to get it out.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How do you get it out?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Same way I been doin', but first they got to let me go back to work.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're gonna offer to set him up?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If I get let off. Otherwise, fuck 'em.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's very possible Ordell's killed somebody.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I ain't goin' to jail, and I ain't doin' that probation thing again.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How do you feel about getting old?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're not old. You look great.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm asking how you feel. Does it bother you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's not really something I think about.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Okay, I'm a little sensitive about my hair. It started falling out ten years ago. So I did something about it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How'd you feel about it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm fine with it, or I wouldn't of done it, I did it to feel better about myself, and I do. When I look in the mirror it looks like me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's different with men.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You know, I can't really feel too sorry for you in that department.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: My ass ain't the same.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bigger?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Does something else worry you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I just feel like I'm always starting over. You said how many bonds you wrote?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Fifteen thousand.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, I've flown seven million miles. And I've been waitin' on people almost twenty years. The best job I could get after my bust was Cabo Air, which is about the worst job you can get in this industry. I make about sixteen thousand, with retirement benefits, ain't worth a damn. And now with this arrest hanging over my head, I'm scared. If I lose my job I gotta start all over again, but I got nothin' to start over with. I'll be stuck with whatever I can get. And that scares me more than Ordell.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well, hello.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Surprise.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I walked right past you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I know, ignoring me. What're you up to?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Catching a movie.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What'd ya see?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: "American President"

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How was it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Pretty good. Me and Annette Bening are goin steady.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh, are you? Does she know that?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No...  ...I don't believe she's ever heard of me. But that doesn't mean we're not going steady.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Does it happen to all men?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well, I'd never be so bold as to speak for all men, but as or myself and a few of my friends, that's definitely the case. There's a lot of actresses out there you like, and there's some you have crushes on. But there's always one who you love. And with her it's sorta like going steady.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And Annette's it for you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: For now. These relationships never last too long.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Who was your girl before Annette?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sandra Bullock. You know her?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah, she's the girl who drove the bus in "Speed." She's cute.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She's adorable. But I had to end it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm old enough to be her father.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How old's Annette?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What're you, a bag lady?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I go back to work tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You talk them into it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They seem to like the idea.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bring the money in and they follow it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yea, but I'm going to dress it up. Put the money in a shopping bag and hand it to someone I meet here.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You don't actually do it that way?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He always just picked it up at my place. But with A.T.F. involved, I want to stage it. You know, make it look more intriguing, like we know what the fuck we're doin'. Then it's up to Ray Nicolet, the A.T.F. guy to follow the shopping bag.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Make the delivery somewhere in the mall.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Right around here, in the food court.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sit down, leave the bag under the table?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Will Ordell go for that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm helping him bring his money into America. He loves the idea. You just missed him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He was here?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah, we were goin' over everything. That's why all the bags.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I called you last night.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I know, I got your message. Ray wanted to have dinner. He wanted to talk about the sting we're plotting. That's what he calls it. A sting. He's being real nice to me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You think he's got a thing for you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Maybe. But I'm thinking it might be something like he wants the money for himself.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't follow your logic. What does his being nice to you have to do with him wanting Ordell's money?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He's setting me up to make a proposition.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You don't propose something like that unless you're pretty sure the other person's into it.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Has he hinted around?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not really. But I knew this narcotics cop one time. Told me that in a raid, the whole package never gets back to the station. His exact words.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You know some interesting people.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He weren't bullshittin' either, 'cause later he was suspended and forced to retire.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Has Nicolet told you any colorful stories like that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He tries to act cool.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No harm in that. He's a young guy havin' fun being a cop. I know the type, trust me on this. He's more interested in Ordell than the money. If he's gonna do anything suspect, it'll be cutting corners to get the conviction; but he wouldn't walk off with the money. It's evidence.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What about you Max?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What? If I was in Nicolet's place?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, I mean you, right now. Not it you were somebody else.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If I saw a way to walk off with a shopping bag full of money, would I take it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You know where it came from. It's not like it's anybody's life savings. It wouldn't even be missed.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: A half-a-million dollars will always be missed.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're avoiding the question.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Okay, sure. I might be tempted. Especially now, since I'm getting out of the bail bonds business.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I have to stand behind all my active bonds, but I'm not writing any new ones.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: A lot of reasons. But the main one would be I'm tired of it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: When did you decide?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's been a long time coming. I finally made up my mind -- I guess it was Thursday.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hi, I'm Max Cherry. Your bail bondsman.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The day you got me out of jail?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, that night I went to pick up a guy. I hear he's staying at this house, so I sneak in, wait for him to come home.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Wait a minute. After we were together you went and snuck into a guy's house?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Got another gun and a stun gun...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And went to this guy's house in El Monte, and I waited for him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What do you do when he comes home?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Shoot him with the stun gun. While he's incapacitated, cuff him, take 'em to County.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You do that?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's my job.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Did you do it that night?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He never came home. But I'm sitting on the couch, in the dark, holding my stun gun and the whole house smells of mildew -- So after a couple hours I think, "What am I doing here? Nineteen years of this shit? So I made up my mind, that's it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And is that it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: More or less.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm not sure you answered my question.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If you had a chance, unemployed now, to walk off with a half-million dollars, would you take it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I believe I said I'd be tempted.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Don't even think about it. You could get yourself killed go to prison...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What if I've figured a way?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The feds. It's evidence.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It may be evidence once they get their hands on it, but right now it's only money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're rationalizing.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's what you do to go through with the shit you start. You rationalize. I can do this, Max, I know I can. But I can't do it without you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I told them Ordell's changed the amount he's bringing in.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Do you think they bought it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh, yeah. I got them thinking Ordell's real nervous. They love thinking he's scared of them.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You know, a good cop won't let you know he knows you're fulla shit.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: All he needed was a reasonable explanation.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It'll be more than that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Don't be so literal. Ray believed it.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: But you still have to show him the money at the airport.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, you know I'm not going to show him the whole amount. He'll see fifty thousand.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Where's the rest of it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: In the bag underneath.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What if he checks it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He won't -- I mean, he didn't the last time. He'll be expecting fifty thousand and there it is -- on top.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're takin' a helluva chance kid.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not really. If he finds it, I say Mr. Walker put the money in, and I didn't know nothing about it. Like the coke.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Then you're out and you get nothing.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah, but I'm not in jail and I tried.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're gonna have surveillance all over you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's why you don't make a move till I come out of the fitting room.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: In a dress.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, a suit. There's one I had my eye on.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How'd you find out?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: All Winston had to do was ask around. Ordell's living in Long Beach with a woman junkie.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How does Winston find him if A.T.F. and all the local Police can't?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: People talk to Winston. He's street, same as them, they trust him. They get busted, they know somebody who can bond them out. I thought I might drop in on him. He'll no doubt be surprised to see me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He's liable to shoot you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: On the phone I told him I have the ten thousand he put up for your bond. I could bring the money and the papers for him to sign. Walk out and call the Sheriff's department.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ray wants him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Everybody wants him, he's a homicide suspect. It doesn't matter who brings him in, he's gonna name you as an accessory.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's why A.T.F.'s gotta make the case. I'm their witness. They wouldn't have a case without me. If it's his word against mine, who are they gonna believe?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's not that simple.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It never was, so I'm not gonna start worrying about it now. Look, Ray more or less believes my story, and he more or less doesn't care. All he really gives a shit about is getting Ordell.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So how do we give Ordell to Nicolet?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Get Ordell to come to your office.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Set him up.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Tell him you want to see him?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Tell him I want to give him his money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I've chickened out. I'm afraid of him. He'll like that.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What do you tell Nicolet?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ordell called and wants to meet me and I'm scared.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We get Ordell to come to my office. Nicolet -- is he already there, or does he come busting in while we're chatting?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He's already there.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What if he hears something he's not supposed to?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, we don't let that happen, now do we?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I got your package. It was fun getting a half-a-million dollars in the mail.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Less ten percent.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah, your fee. I had to figure that out, since there wasn't no note.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Only this isn't a bail bond, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I hesitated taking that much.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You worked for it -- if you're sure that's all you want.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm sure.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I saw Ray the other day. Boy is he pissed he missed all the excitement.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What's he doing?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He's on to a new thing. He's after a guy who owns a gun shop he says is "woefully and wantonly" selling assault rifles to minors. He says he's gonna take him down if it's the last thing he does.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Did you tell him you were leaving?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I told him I might.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's Ordell's.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They've confiscated all his other stuff. But this one's sorta left over. The registration's in the glove box, the keys were under the seat... What's a matter, haven't you ever borrowed someone's car?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Not after they're dead.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I didn't use you, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I didn't say you did.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I never lied to you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We're partners.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm fifty-five-years old. I can't blame anybody for anything I do.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do you blame yourself for helping me?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'd feel a whole lot better if you took some more money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You'll get over that.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Where're you going?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Spain.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Madrid or Barcelona?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Start off in Madrid. Ever been there?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Wanna go?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Thanks, but you have a good time.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sure I can't twist your arm?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Thank you for saying that, but no. My business.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I thought you were tired of your business?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm just tired in general.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Are you scared of me?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You tell those guys they'll have to do one helluva lot better than that before I'll even say 'hi' to them.

turns.speaker: PUBLIC DEFENDER
turns.text: Well, that's the State's offer. If you plead to possession and tell L.A.P.D. what they want to know, your bond will be set at one-thousand dollars. If you don't, L.A.P.D. will request one at twenty-five thousand based on your prior record and risk of flight. If you don't post it or don't know anyone who can, you'll spend six to eight weeks in County before your arraignment comes up.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Who's side are you on?

turns.speaker: PUBLIC DEFENDER
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What if I plead guilty?

turns.speaker: PUBLIC DEFENDER
turns.text: And cooperate? You might get probation.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If I don't cooperate?

turns.speaker: PUBLIC DEFENDER
turns.text: With the prior? You could get anywhere from a year to five depending on the judge. You want to think about it? You got two minutes before we're up.

turns.speaker: SHERONDA
turns.text: He say we like the same thing as married.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do you live together?

turns.speaker: SHERONDA
turns.text: Most of the times.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not every day?

turns.speaker: SHERONDA
turns.text: Sometimes every day, for a while.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Then you don't see him for a few days?

turns.speaker: SHERONDA
turns.text: Yes'm.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You know what's in the bag you're taking?

turns.speaker: SHERONDA
turns.text: He say is a surprise.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, Sheronda, it was nice talking to you.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Oh, Miss Brown?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: And what would this be, Sweet and Low?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What the fuck is that shit?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: I know what it looks like.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You planted that shit on me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Look, that shit ain't mine.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: It isn't enough for Trafficking, but how 'bout Posession with the Intent to Distribute?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: We'll just be a minute.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Can I smoke?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Thanks for waiting, Jackie. Now tell me, what can we do for you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I need permission to leave the country so I keep my job.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: We can look into that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I need it tomorrow. If I don't show up for work tomorrow, I'm fired.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You know what we want.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If I'm working, I can help you.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Oh, so now you know him?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You never asked me if I did or not.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: No shit. You know how he makes his money?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He sells guns.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You ever see him sell guns?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Then how do you know he sells guns?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He told me. Besides, why else would an A.T.F. man be after him?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: How can you help us?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Short of wearing a wire, I'll do everything I can to help you throw his ass in jail. And in exchange for my help, I need permission to leave the country and immunity.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: This is A.T.F. agent Ray Nicolet, Jackie Brown, Ordell Robbie money exchange trial run. It's three p.m., July 4th 1997. The location is the parking structure at LAX.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: I'm recording this.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I thought you were going to let this one through.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: The envelope contains ten thousand dollars. The subject will be delivering the currency in a...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: A Broadway shopping bag.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ordell has a white guy working for him named Louis.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You two meet?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: This afternoon before I came here. He was with Ordell at an apartment in Hermosa Beach. I don't know if he lives there, but I can find out.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You talk to him?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: His full name is Louis Gara. He just got out from serving four years in Susanville.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Bank robbery? Do you know what he does for Ordell?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I imagine shit needs to be done.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: We've been following Mr. Gara, and he's definitely working for Ordell.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: ...Compton with a fifty-six-year- old petty thief -- woman named Simone Hawkins.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Ever meet her, or they talk about her?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Who's the other one?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: White girl named Melanie Ralston. Another girlfriend of Ordell's.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: What's her story?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It was her coke I got busted with. She knows everything, but she's not part of it, and she's pissed cause she's not part of it. Ordell wouldn't even let her stay at the meeting. She tried to talk me into ripping off Ordell.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: And splittin' with her?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm sure that was the idea.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I smiled and walked away. She also told me Ordell killed Beaumont.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: She told you that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Was she there?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: She didn't say.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: But she mentioned Beaumont by name?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Well, this sounds like a lady I'd like to have a word with. So everything's set for tomorrow?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Right. Everything's the same, except one change...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You said that the last time.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Well, it's true, isn't it? After this is buttoned up we could meet someplace else. What do you think?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We could, if I'm not in jail.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Oh, that's taken care of. I called the State Attorney's Office. You were no-filed this morning in Circuit Court.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: That's fifty thousand, huh? It doesn't look like that much.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I was told ten thousand in each pack.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You didn't count it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I never have. It's not my money.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Ever been tempted?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: What? To put one of these in my pocket?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: If I did, I'd have to give you one, wouldn't I? Or we could take what we want. No one knows how much there is except us, right?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yes. All those things are true.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: After all, it don't belong to nobody, right?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That would be one point of view.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Yeah, well, it's not a point of view that A.T.F. shares. Once we make it evidence, it belongs to us. You are now officially out of trouble. Don't do nothing stupid, now.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How can I do anything if I'm being watched every second?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: I'm glad you realize that. Saves me the trouble of pointing it out to you.  Put this in your shopping bag. It's what I expect to find when I look in Sheronda's. Comprende?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Si.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I thought I did.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You didn't. I would think with all this on your mind, you'd wait till after.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I got there early. I've had my eye on this suit -- Wait, let's start over. I got there early. The idea was to try on the suit, see if I liked it. If I did, get them to wrap it up, and change back into my uniform. That's what Sheronda's expecting me to wear. Go meet Sheronda, give her the bag with fifty thousand, and go home.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: But you didn't do that.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Because I didn't have it. Ray, I swear, Melanie came in and grabbed it.  And someone killed her for it.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Where's the bag she gave you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: She didn't give me one. I told you before, Melanie wasn't part of the plan. Ordell must of told her to do it. She bursts in, grabs the shopping bag, and takes off. What am I supposed to do, go after her? I'm in my fucking underwear. I had to get dressed before I could do anything. So I put this back on 'cause could put this on faster than I could my uniform.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You took the time to pay the saleswoman.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I had to. I was frantic. I didn't know what to do.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: What did you do after that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I went looking for you. I went straight to the bookstore, 'cause that's where you were last time, but you weren't there. How the hell else am I supposed to let anybody know what happened? You didn't tell me how to do that, did you? I knew I was under surveillance, so when I couldn't spot anybody, I started yelling.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: There was a guy with Melanie?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Not in the fitting room.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: We had our agent on you. She sees a blonde come out of the fitting room carrying a Robinson's/May bag and tussle with a tough-looking white guy. The white guy takes the shopping bag and they go.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: This guy with Melanie, that was Louis Gara?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I didn't see him. I was in my underwear. If it was a white guy, it was probably Louis. He kill Melanie?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: It's possible. You're saying you don't have any idea what happened to that fifty thousand?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I have no idea.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: You'd take a polygraph on it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: If it'll make you happy.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: I sure hope you haven't done anything dumb Jackie.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: Louis Gara's dead. L.A.P.D. found him dead in a car on Ninth. And we've lost Ordell.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I thought you were watching him.

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: We were, and we lost him. He walked into a strip bar sometime around three thirty and never came out. The bar was on Ninth, less than a mile- and-a-half from where Louis was found dead. It looks like Louis's friend shot him twice at point blank range.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: So what happens now?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: We pick up Ordell. We've got three murders we can link him to. We have the storage unit where he keeps his guns, by tomorrow we'll have a search warrant to go in and get him. And we have you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do you think I took some of that money?

turns.speaker: NICOLET
turns.text: I have no evidence of your taking anything. You didn't pay for your snazzy new suit with marked bills; I was glad to see that. You've been helping us out, you gave us Melanie and Louis. Melanie had a packet of marked bills stuffed in her shorts when they found her, which goes a long way backing up your story.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh, hi.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Buy ya a beer?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm waiting for the phone.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Good luck. That guy's been in there since I got here.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, I guess I better look for another one, then. Thanks, anyway.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Great...  ...Wanda!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Killian's.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Better get me another Sam's.  Join me in a Jaeger shot?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Uh-uh.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Gimme one anyway.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How long you been with Ordell?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: This time? Almost a year. I've known him forever.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What were you two fighting about?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: He told me to go outside.  "You may leave us now." It's all part of his pathetic attempt to be "the man." You know Mr. Walker don't you?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Mr. Walker's my buddy. Ask him about Ordell.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That coke was yours, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: He said he didn't know about it.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You believe that? Yeah, well, I guess you have to trust him.  I'd have second thoughts on that, but then I know 'em.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: He killed a guy who works for him the other day.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Beaumont Livingston?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You already knew that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Kinda.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: So tell me. Having all that money in your flight bag -- Is it tempting?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You think I'm kidding?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Dreaming.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You know how easy it would be? He won't be anywhere near that mall. Pull one more switch, up front. That's it. Half-a-million dollars. Need help?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Keep it between us girls?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: What's that fucker ever done for us?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't think so, but thanks for the beer.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Jackie?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Hi, Melanie.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Are you getting that black suit?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah, do you like it?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: It looks good on you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Do you got something for me?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: You betcha.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I put a little cherry on top. You're right. What the hell he ever do for us?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Now be careful with that bag. You don't want it ripping open on you in the middle of the store.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: How you doing, Ms. Jackie?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I was expecting you. Come in.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I got some vodka in the freezer.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Got some o.j.?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, then, why don't you be a good hostess and make me a screwdriver?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Who you think got your ass outta jail?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The same guy who put me in, thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Hey, you get caught with blow, that's your business.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I'magine they asked who you givin' it to, too.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They asked.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: And what was your answer?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I said I wanted to talk to a lawyer.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You positive about that? You weren't nervous and let something slip by mistake? If you did, I ain't mad, I just gotta know.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Beaumont Livingston.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I knew it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: And they asked if I knew Mr. Walker.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I didn't tell 'em anything.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: This fella Beaumont, they say what happened to him?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They told me.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: What do you think it is?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I think it's a gun pressing against my dick.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You thought right... Now take your hands from around my throat, nigga.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: What the hell you doin'?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Shut your ass up and grab the wall!

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Now, baby, that's got nothin' to do with you. I just carry that. You been listenin' to them cops too much.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The cops didn't try and strangle my ass.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Damn, Jackie, I was just playin' with you.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, I ain't playin with you. I'm gonna unload both these motherfuckers, you don't do what I tell you. Understand what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Baby, I ain't come here -- She shoves both guns in Ordell's back.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I said, you understand what I'm saying

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I understand woman, damn!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Go sit over in that chair.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I'm tellin' you, those cops been fuckin' wit your mind. They turn black against black, that's how they do.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Shut your raggedy ass up and sit down.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I just came here to talk.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Way I see it, me and you only got one thing to talk about. What you willing to do for me?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Let's get realistic, baby. Sooner or later they're gonna get around to offering me a plea deal, and you know that. That's why you came here to kill me.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Baby, I didn't --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's okay. I forgive you. Now, let's say if I tell on you, I walk. And if I don't, I go to jail.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: One hundred thousand put in an escrow account in my name, if I'm convicted up to a year, or put on probation. If I have to do more than a year, you pay another hundred thousand.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I got a problem...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: All your money's in Mexico.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I been thinkin about that, too, and I got me a idea.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'll talk to the cops tomorrow and tell you if it's on.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Talk to you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The Cockatoo Inn.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: The Cockatoo Inn? Where's that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's right on Hawthorne Boulevard and Manhattan Beach Boulevard. It's red brick...

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Oh, wait, you mean that place that has the big sign with a rooster on it?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's a cockatoo.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: I bet you come here on a Saturday night, you need nigga repellent keep 'em off your ass.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I do okay.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You a fine lookin' woman, Jackie. I bet you do a damn sight better than okay. You think anybody followed you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't think so, but it don't really matter. They know I'm meeting you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: How the fuck they know that?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I told them.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: You told em? You told em it's me?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They already know it's you.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Well, shit. That don't mean you gotta confirm it!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Look, the only way I can get permission to fly is if I agree to help them. Which is what I have to appear to be doing. So I give them something they already know. You.

turns.speaker: ORDELL
turns.text: Didja tell 'em anything else?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I told them you got a half a million dollars in Mexico, and you want me to bring it here.
